body.p: Since the sample proportion has a normal distribution, its values follow the Standard Deviation Rule. What interval is almost certain (probability .997) to contain the sample proportion of left-handed people?

explanation.p: Since the Standard Deviation Rule applies, the probability is approximately .997 that the sample proportion falls within 3 standard deviations of its mean, that is, between .1 - 3(.02) and .1 + 3(.02). There is roughly a 99.7% chance, therefore, that the sample proportion falls in the interval (.04, .16).
